str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and ginomai; to become near, i.e. Approach; by implication, to appear publicly.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To know, know of, understand. Apparently a middle voice of ephistemi; to put the mind upon, i.e. Comprehend, or be acquainted with.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A space of time or interval; by extension, an individual opportunity; by implication, delay.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From epi and the base of basis; to walk upon, i.e. Mount, ascend, embark, arrive.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Asia, i.e. Asia Minor, or only its western shore.
